title: Almost classical skew bracoids
abstract:
We investigate two sub-classes of skew bracoids, the first consists of those
we term almost a brace, meaning the multiplicative group decomposes as a
certain semi-direct product, and then those that are almost classical, which
additionally specifies the relationship between the multiplicative group and
the additive. Skew bracoids with these properties have applications in
Hopf-Galois theory, in particular for questions concerning the Hopf-Galois
correspondence, and can also yield solutions to the set-theoretic Yang-Baxter
equation. We use this skew bracoid perspective to give a new construction
building on the induced Hopf-Galois structures of Crespo, Rio and Vela, recover
a result of Greither and Pareigis on the Hopf-Galois correspondence, and
examine the solutions that arise from skew bracoids, in particular where more
than one solution may be drawn from a single skew bracoid.
